result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott B Goodwin

records.addlTxt:
9:26 AM Defendant Scott B Goodwin in court.  Attorney Timothy S. Gebert in court for Scott B Goodwin.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Knaapen gives the court his sentencing recommendation. Attorney Gebert makes a statement regarding sentencing w/ his recommendation. Defendant makes a statement to the court.

1:15 PM Defendant Scott B Goodwin in court.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Timothy S. Gebert in court for Scott B Goodwin. 
Officer Schulz is sworn in and testifies. Testifies to being a Deputy with the Wood County Sheriff's Department. Testifies to seeing a motorcycle that was exceeding the posted speed limit. Testifies to the radar reading the motorcycle at 70 MPH. Testifies to pursuing the motorcycle to try and catch up to it. Testifies to the motorcycle breaking suddenly and coming to a stop in the middle of the road. Testifies to the motorcycle doing a U turn around the squad car and accelerate away. Testifies to the motorcycle slowing down again and then accelerated speed. Testifies to the motorcycle attempting another U turn and entering the ditch. Testifies to the defendant being the driver. Witness identifies the defendant in court, court recognizes. 
Attorney Gebert cross examines the witness. Witness testifies to the distances of when lights were activated and when he activated his siren.

Court finds probable cause to believe a felony was committed and the defendant committed it.

Bond is continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court finds probable cause to continue this matter. This will be bound over for preliminary hearing and arraignment. Bond is set.
